core_requirements.notes: Non-waivable. Required for all students. Taken in Fall Q1 of first year.
Fixed core marketing course. Taken in Fall of first year.
Covers microeconomic foundations: demand estimation, cost minimization, pricing, market equilibrium, and game theory. Taken in Fall Q1.
Covers oligopoly, advanced pricing strategies, risk management, asymmetric information, and principal-agent theory. Taken in Fall Q2.
STAT6130 is 1.0 CU, STAT6210 (accelerated) is 0.5 CU. Students can place into STAT6210 via exam. Core requirement is 0.5 CU minimum.
Students complete WHCP through one 0.5 CU course in Fall or Spring, assigned by cohort. WHCP6160 (Management Communication) or WHCP6180 (Entrepreneurial Communication, requires pre-approval).
Students select one 1.0 CU course. ACCT6110 focuses on financial accounting; ACCT6130 covers both financial and managerial accounting. Can be waived with substitution.
Students select one course. FNCE6110 is 1.0 CU (full course), FNCE6210 is 0.5 CU (abbreviated for non-majors). Finance/Quant Finance majors must take FNCE6110. Can be waived with substitution.

Students select one course. FNCE6130 is 1.0 CU (full course), FNCE6230 is 0.5 CU (abbreviated for non-majors). Finance/Quant Finance majors must take FNCE6130. Cannot take both FNCE6210 and FNCE6230. Can be waived with substitution.
Students select one 0.5 CU course from the three options.
Students select one 1.0 CU course. MGMT6110 focuses on large established firms; MGMT6120 focuses on startups and emerging enterprises.
Students select one 0.5 CU course. Both build on MKTG6110. Can be waived with substitution.
Students must complete 1.0 CU total. Can take two 0.5 CU courses or one 1.0 CU course (OIDD6900 alone fulfills requirement). All courses except OIDD6900 are 0.5 CU.

fixed_core.description: All fixed core requirements must be met through completion or placement
fixed_core.note: STAT6130 is 1.0 CU but only 0.5 CU required; STAT6210 (accelerated) is 0.5 CU

flex_core.description: All flexible core requirements must be met by selecting from available courses to fulfill credit requirements
flex_core.note: Some flex cores can be waived with required substitutions

total_credits.description: Total core curriculum must equal at least 9.5 CU including any required substitutions

finance_major_requirements.description: Finance and Quantitative Finance majors must complete 2.0 CU from Finance flexible core

prohibited_combinations.description: Certain course combinations are not allowed

rules.reason: Cannot enroll in both FNCE6210 and FNCE6230

waiver_timing.description: Waiver requests must be submitted during summer before Pre-Term

substitution_timing.description: Substitution courses can be taken any semester after waiver approval

letter_grade_requirement.description: All core courses must be taken for a letter grade unless specifically exempted

placement_rules.description: If placed into an accelerated version, must take that version instead of default
